intro: Oncostemum ovatoacuminatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf oncostemum, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with narrow, ovate leaves that gradually taper to a point. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the dry season. Oncostemum ovatoacuminatum is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils.
